thoughts.text: We need to check if the 'lsof' command is already installed on the system. We can do this by running the 'which lsof' command and checking if it returns a location for the 'lsof' command.
thoughts.reasoning: Running the 'which lsof' command will tell us if the 'lsof' command is already installed on the system and where it is located. This will help us determine if we need to install the 'lsof' command manually.
thoughts.plan: - Run the 'which lsof' command to check if the 'lsof' command is already installed on the system
thoughts.criticism: We should have checked if the 'lsof' command was already installed on the system before trying to install it. This would have prevented the error we encountered.
thoughts.speak: We need to check if the 'lsof' command is already installed on the system. We can do this by running the 'which lsof' command.
